comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: She was born in Oakland CA and was a public schoolteacher there before she went to Stanford.  She earned her PhD there in 1908, and became a Professor of Zoology there.  In 1929 she was named a Fellow of the California Academy of Sciences.  She was by no means wealthy, but she was known for helping struggling students with their tuition, and for supporting the Children's Museum in Palo Alto.

comment.author: 25053835@N03
comment._content: These are lovely details. Where did you find them?

comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Oh, sorry! It's a PDF, a memorial resolution at Stanford: histsoc.stanford.edu/pdfmem/McCrackenM.pdf
